JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
In the Nordics we provide the widest range of smart solutions in the rail market, from innovative high-speed rolling stock, metros and trams to maintenance, modernisation, infrastructure, and signalling. Employing 2500 people in our offices in Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Finland as well as 20 train services depots across the Nordics.

 

This is an exciting opportunity to join a world leading engineering company where you will work alongside qualified and experienced staff. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where 80,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide.

 

The programme takes place in our offices from Sweden, Norway or Denmark, depending on your location.

Please apply only to one programme that corresponds to your current location.

If you are not based in any of the Nordic countries, please apply only to one preferred location.

 

 

What Will You Do?

 We offer multiple opportunities within our Services, Rolling Stock or Digital and Integrated Solutions Business product lines.

 

You will complete 12 months development programme whilst providing a tangible contribution to the success of the team. The programme starts on 1st September 2025.

  • You will undertake four rotations of three months each around the various departments and locations of the company, gaining an understanding of the business and the service operation lifecycle through participating in strategic projects. Developing your knowledge during your time at Alstom is key, along with developing your skills and experience.
  • The first and last rotation will be in your base location which matches best your background and interest. In Denmark this will be Copenhagen.
  • The program aims the possibility of an international rotation within our Nordics organisation.
  • As a group of graduates, you will have the chance to come together a couple of times and exchange experience, learn about the Alstom values through inspirational workshops, and work together on a group assignment. 

 

You will have the opportunity to complete on the job learning, which is complemented by a personal development programme. Supported by a mentor, you will gain cross functional experience and understanding of the organization.

 

Who are we looking for?

  • You are about to graduate or have graduated within the last two years with a master's degree in engineering.
  • Background in the following programs or similar:
    • Railway engineering or systems
    • Computer science
    • Electrical/Electronic engineering
    • System Engineering

 

  • Fluent in one of Scandinavian languages and in English.
  • Fast learning and combining problem-solving skills with a can-do attitude, desire for improvement and a passion for making things happen.

 

What’s next?

By applying to this Alstom Nordics Graduate Programme, you will enter our recruitment process:

  • After a first screening of your resume, you will receive an invitation to complete online (logical thinking & personality) tests if you meet the requirements above.
  • When matching our profile, there will be a short video interview on Microsoft Teams.
  • Finally, you will have an interview with the hiring team in Copenhagen.

 

In a final stage, we will offer this opportunity immediately as a permanent contract. The graduate programme will take 12 months to complete. Based on that experience, we will explore together the best suitable position for you within our organization.

 

Why Alstom?

We are a global leader in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with opportunities across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?
